subject: Re: [junit] Re: Dynamic parameters and TestSuites
msgSnippet: ... Sadly no, and the JUnit archive UI is so annoying that I don t have the patience to look. ... That s a good start. If you get 3 or more properties, switch
messageBody:
mc_julie_mccabe wrote:

> Hello,
>
> Thanks for the quick response.
>
> I can not locate information about the Parameterized Test Case - all I can
> find is that it should be in the Junit archives - does anybody have a link?

Sadly no, and the JUnit archive UI is so annoying that I don't have the
patience to look.

> Therefore I will try using a property in the JVM.

That's a good start. If you get 3 or more properties, switch to a
properties file.

...and buy /JUnit Recipes/, which will ship in the next two weeks. :)
